Description: Thiel frames Trump as a "Builder" needed to reconstruct a broken America, contrasting with Clinton's "Manager" archetype.
Thiel predicts the Trump movement "is not going away" regardless of the election result, positioning himself as a prophet of structural change.
Post reports on Thiel's "tremendous clout" during the transition, organizing the Tech Summit and bridging the gap between Trump and Silicon Valley.
Revelation that "America First" Thiel bought citizenship in New Zealand as a "doomsday hedge." Framed as hypocritical globalism.
Coverage of the public offering framed as an "Anti-Valley Manifesto." Validates Thiel's focus on defense/intel over consumer tech.
Investigative reports on Palantir serving as the "Immigration OS" for deportations. Highlights tension between state efficiency and civil liberties.
Explosive report (with ProPublica) revealing a tax-free fortune amassed via loophole. Framed as a symbol of "Financial Singularity" and inequality.
Thiel exits Facebook board to focus on "political warfare" (Midterms). Marks the end of his attempt to steer Big Tech from within.
Reports link Thiel to FBI informant Charles Johnson. Paints a "gray zone" picture of Thiel's operation overlapping with federal intelligence.
Leaked audio of Thiel arguing that tech critics take the form of the "Antichrist." Reveals the theological/mystic dimension of his accelerationism.
Palantir stock drops as Trump admin cuts defense spending. The "Kingmaker" is ironically hit by the fiscal austerity of the regime he helped install.

Key Insight: Thiel frames Trump as a "Builder" to rebuild America
Thiel predicts the Trump movement "is not going away"
Reports on Thiel's "tremendous clout" during transition

WaPo Context: "To many, it was a stunning revelation... Thiel's role in right-wing politics has only grown."
Revealed he bought citizenship in a "doomsday" haven
Revealed he has a massive tax-free fortune
Leaked lectures reveal he views tech critics as the "Antichrist"
